page.title: 13Farming C: Main Farming
page.content: In the majority of cases the main farming industry in the locality is the production of milk. The herd size varies but is usually around the hundred mark. The introduction by the EEC recently of milk quotas has tended to result in a reduction of cattle feed rather than of herd size. Alongside the production of milk is the rearing of dairy heifers and beef stores which are sold at two years old for fattening. In some cases, hundreds of store lambs are bought in the autumn to fatten on the winter grass and are sold early the following spring. Besides dairy and beef cattle and sheep the other main farming industry is the growing of corn although this is a very minor concern in this area.
